page.title: 03CLAY EXTRACTION-WATER SUPPLY
page.content: The company of English China Clays Limited has three pits in the Lee Moor area.The china clay is obtained by breaking up the surface with high pressure water hoses,which force water out at over 250 p.s.i.About 1,800 gallons are used every minute.Part of the water comes from the river Plym and the rest is recycled from the processing plant.As this goes on 24 hours a day,7 days a week it means they use about eighteen million gallons every week.The hoses are remote-controlled and the force of water is so strong it washes out the sand and mica,as well as the china clay.The water from the river Plym is piped to the china clay pits but fortunately it is gravity fed and does not need to be pumped.Water is vital for the extraction of china clay at Lee Moor.
